doc.after: A detachment of 18 men of the 1st The Royal Dragoons, commanded by Captain Methuen,[48] arrived in Ely from Bury on May 23 in the late afternoon. They marched through the streets as a show of force, remaining all night.[34] The following afternoon, 24Â May, the troops marched on Littleport, led by Sir Henry Bate Dudley and John Bacon, a Bow Street constable. They were followed by the Royston troop of volunteer yeomanry cavalry summoned earlier by Henry Law,[43] and a militia of gentlemen and inhabitants of Ely.[1]
